front.title: An Overview of Operations, Administration, and Maintenance (OAM) Data Plane Tools

abstract.t: Operations, Administration, and Maintenance (OAM) is a general term that refers to a toolset for fault detection and isolation, and for performance measurement. Over the years various OAM tools have been defined for various layers in the protocol stack. This document summarizes some of the data plane OAM tools defined in the IETF in the context of IP unicast, MPLS, pseudowires, MPLS for the transport profile (MPLS-TP), and TRILL. The target audience of this document includes network equipment vendors, network operators and standard development organizations, and can be used as an index to some of the main data plane OAM tools defined in the IETF.
